text: Bottle thanks to TheAlum! Pours clear chestnut, small beige head, dissipates fairly quickly, decent lacing. Aroma is huge raspberry and vinous notes, grapes, red wine, raspberry seeds, ruby port, grape must. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, huge berries and vinous notes again, light bourbon. Medium body, low carbonation. Pretty tasty.
750ml bottle number 152 pours a dark hazy brown with a tan head. Bourbon Berries and sweet malt taste.
Bottle. Brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is vanilla, roasted malt, hop, caramel. Flavour is vanilla, roasted malt, hop, toffee, berries, caramel. Very nice beer.

Bottle 750ml. @ [ Fastelavn Smagning - Carnival Tasting, Ulfborg ]. [ As Three Floyds Cabra ].[ Bottle # 349/574 ]. Clear dark brown color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, caramel, wood, alcohol - whisky, rapsberry notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, chocolate, raspberry - raspberry juice. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140301]

Pre pale ale tasting/Dolle und Halling Maters of the Universe tasting. Bottle 372/579. Dark brown body with a medium offwhite head. Fresh berries, dark fruit, ripe fruit, oak, caramel, sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Pre Pale Ale Tasting/ Dolle und Halling Masters Of The Universe Tasting. Bottle 372/579. Pours dark brown with a small creamy layer. Nose is sweet of toffee and some good cherries. Some vanilla and barrel. Smooth and vinous. Soft. Caramel and fresh red berries. Really lovely. It works.

Sampled at Dark Lord Day 2014. Murky brown pour with a tan head. Aroma of bourbon, berries, dark sugars. Some toffee and roasted malt notes. Flavor is mostly booze and umami, lots of whiskey and meaty notes. Some berry sweetness. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Finishes with whiskey notes.

Bottle at Fastelavn Smagning 2014 @ J&Cs beer palace, Jutland Saturday Session 2 - 01/03/14. 
Hazed mahogony brown with light beige spotting and edgework. 
Nose is berry fruit, sweet tones, sublte bourbon BA notes, oaky, dark toffee, raspberry tang. 
Taste comprises brown sugars, coconut shavings, big raspberry blast, sweet toffee, hint of bourbon. 
Medium + body with fine carbonation.
Decent BA affair, probably the best beer Ive had from this fantasy style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle courtesy of Jan at Craigs doing a Chris O tasting, Edingburgh (ta for the beer Jan) Saturday 14th March   Pours puddle brown cloudy beer. Lots of whisky on the nose, interestingly I just got a little marzipan, this is quite heavy with alcohol, mmhh.. really spirity not my thing sadly.  A6 A3 T6 P3 Ov11 2.9
At home... Deep black... Thin tan lacing... Light oxididsed roast malt nose... Blackcurrant... Big whisky... Soft berry when you know... Quite a lot in fact but the whisky overpowers

Bottle, 75cl. Bottle 349/579. It pours an unclear, brown body and a dense, beige head. The aroma has a lightly sourish touch, with roasted notes, toffee and some earthy hints. Some sourness in the flavor too, still sweet, with roasted malts and some coffee hints. Full body and a pleasant carbonation level. Roasted finish with some sourish notes and dried fruits, some raspberry all the way, but just a touch. A quite nice one. 140301

Bottle 650ml Bottle #349/579 @ fonefan
Pours cloudy brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of caramel, raspberries, chocolate and wood. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light to medium bitter finish with a long raspberries and caramel finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Sort skum hvid 
Malt citrus bær vinøs gær 
Bitter moderat sød,lidt 
Oile blød
 @f1

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, raspberries and a little alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet, moderate bitter and light acidic. Dry, moderate bitter and light acidic finish. 010314
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are fruits, berries, malt, vanilla, candy sugar, malt and hops. Sweet finish.

22 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is raspberry fruity. Sweet, fruity and caramelish. Smooth toasted, sweet and lingering caramelish into a fruity finish. Liqourice/sulphorish note.

Bottle. Light hazy deep brown liquid with small to medium light brown head. Aroma of raspberries, bourbon, toffee, vanilla, bread, caramel and raw sugar. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raspberries, bourbon, wood and toffee. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice, no alcohol and very balanced.
Plummy fruity Scottish ale with a muddled old dusty whiskey vanilla presence. Okay. Thanks alum for the neate tick.

Multiple pours tossed my way courtesy of TheAlum,  
Took me a number of hours to take these notes, so theyre damn well going to be cemented her into the database rightquick! 
 
Pours a deep red with not much in the way of head.
 
The aroma is raspberry and whiskey in the most pleasant way possible, woody, rich, sweet smelling, & jammy... but yeah... that doesnt really sound good, but it works here. 
 
The flavor is nicely berry forward with a jammy raspberry note that never takes the beer to a cloying place, the vanilla character is nice and the oakiness is a little subdued, lightly boozy... just a little spicy with some toasty maltiness. 
 
Again, describing it doesnt work very well really, its good but it doesnt seem from my descriptors that it would be.

 
Pretty good, thanks for the pour there Adam

750 ml bottle shared by TheAlum- thanks again, Adam! Bottle number was a bit rubbed off, but looks like 518/579. Pours a hazy plum brown with a small off-white ring for a head. Plenty of berry fruits present, along with what seems like plum, as well as caramel, brown sugar, oak, vanilla, and whiskey. Medium-bodied, with a fruity, malty, gritty mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. It all comes off as completely blended and swirled together; some might say "muddled." Individual notes dont pop clearly. Adam said its a few months beyond its prime, which makes sense. Still very good, though.

Bottle, 05/21/2013, thanks to Kayn169 and FullObs. Pours dark earthy brown, medium frothy tan head dies to a haze covering hald the surface, moderate lacing. Aroma is pressed, pulpy ramble berries, seedy, background of vanilla, dark caramel fudge, oak. Taste of berries initially as well, though not as prominent as the nose, toffee and dark toasted grains, bitter spicy whisky finish. Medium palate, drinks smooth. Can see some similarity with Bramble BCS, but this is definitely different and its own thing. Very nice.
Bottle this pours a dark brown  with a tan head, it had a  berry smell and the booze was nice on this one,also  malty  with hints of oak,overall a nice take on this beer.CHEERS

Pours a dark, orangish brown with minimal head. Not a ton of bourbon in the nose  but mixed berrys are prevelant. Taste is a good blend of vanilla and berry. Think of Berrywiess on steroids. Nice beer.

Redish brown.  Thin head that quickly dissapears.  Strong aroma of mixed berries.  Raspberry blackberry blueberry. Touches of bourbon.  Taste is less berry more bourbon decent amount of vanilla.  Flavors slowly fading.  Different stuff.  Close to bramble without the thick but not as berry strong.  Better mix with the fruit.  Very good stuff.

Sampled at GonzoIllinis Birthday Party (Western Springs, IL). Happy Birthday, Tony! Pours a richer deep brownish pour, some glowing amber copper edges, richer haze in the body. A frothy offwhite head dies to a good film, laces ok. Aromas are gentle tannic raspberry, a touch of fruit. Toasty, gentle peat, caramel, kiss of vanilla. Some red fruit, aided by some raspberry pulp. Richer raspberry as it warms, integrating well with a more toasty, carmelized beer, some deeper sweetness. Initial is richer raspberry, a touch tannic, deeper pulpy and seedy flavors into the middle. Mixing with toast, caramel, and toffee. Thinned approproately, with gentle toast, vanilla, and biscuits. Some heat, touches of vanilla, gentle spirit. Raspberry elements grow into the backend and finish, some toffee, toast, peat. Gentle vanilla, red fruit. Touches of tannic raspberry, gentle fruit, and toasty malts. Gentle growing barrel. Nice.

Big time scents of raspberry and great barrel notes with a bit of whiskey. Taste is similar with big barrel flavors and a nice raspberry flavor hidden in the after taste. You get a bit of the bread/toast flavor of Robert the Bruce, but it is masked quite a bit from the barrel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

#243/579. 750ml red waxxed bottle into a tulip glass. Huge thanks to apocalypsezombie for this bottle.

A - Pours a very dark red body with a two finger high light tan head. Settles down to a thin cap with thick edging and tight bubbling. Average amount of lacing and retention. Some thin and quick falling alcoholic legs.

S - Fresh raspberry preserves and booze. In the background is some light rye spice, vanilla, and toffee rich malts. It comes off very alcohol strong and raspberry heavy, but it really is a fantastic aroma. 

T - Much different than the nose. Starts off with bright raspberry notes, then comes a very mellow and subdued toffee and butterscotch malty flavor that I associate with scotch ales and wee-heavys. A touch of vanilla oak tannins, but the whiskey seems present mostly in a very noticeable warmth and not in the rye spice I was hoping for.

M - Light to medium bodied and somewhat creamy. Tons of carbonation, like far too much.

O - The aroma is excellent, but the taste is just average. I did enjoy it very much, and it actually succeeded in being a rather unique brew. But is it worth $35? Probably not, but it was worth the experience. Perhaps some aging will mellow out the booze a bit,

Very big flavors. Huge tart raspberry up front. Prominent rye barrel on the back end. Disappointing in the sense that Robert the Bruce isn't an obvious backbone to the beer. If that was more distinguishable this beer would be incredible. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a darker brown color, tan-colored head, spotty lace, thin collar. Nose is lots of berries, some malty sweetness, light oak, smooth booze. Reminds me of Bramble, but less booze and more berries (if thats even possible). Flavor is berries, dark fruity, oak, smooth booze, with perhaps a trace of the base beer left after 18 months in barrels. Medium body, good carbonation, creamy sweet finish.

I would call this beer Bramble Lite, as it has a ton of berries but less booze when compared to fresh Bramble. I really enjoyed this one and had a second pour and our group killed the bottle, which is saying a lot. The booze is perfect right now and Im curious to see how the fruit does over the next few months in the bottle. As with Bramble, I think you either like it or hate it...not much in between. Overall, not sure why this one is getting such hate...I liked it.

The aroma is wild... lots of raspberries and fruits on top of some toffee malts.  On the palate, the beer feels soft and rich.  The flavors are quite different.  The raspberry fades into the background and more traditional scotch ale malty flavors with some balanced barrel flavors.  Not much of the whiskey shows through.  Lovely.

Bottle shared by Mike, thanks! Was dark outside while pouring so I dont have much to say for its appearance, but the nose reminded me of BCS Bramble full of berries, oak, and bourbon. Taste was raspberry, blueberry, sweet malts, bourbon, a bit of oak, and a prominent sweet blackberry note (although I dont think there is any blackberry in the beer). None of the taste seemed to come together though and overall it tasted very muddled. Carbonation was good with an even mouthfeel. Glad to try this, especially at $35 because Im not sure that I would go out of my way to ever drink it again. Id love to see more Templeton character and less muddledness in a future batch though.
